title: Alphabets and Sounds
content: You will learn the 26 letters of the alphabet (A–Z) and the sounds they make. Try singing the alphabet song while pointing to each letter.
takehome: Sing the alphabet song every day 🎵
Point to letters in books or signs around you
Try saying the sound of each letter aloud
Find letters in your toys or classroom objects
Draw each letter with colors and decorate them
exercises: Write letters A–Z in your notebook ✏️
Circle letters you see in your room
Match letters to pictures (A → Apple, B → Ball)

title: Simple Words
content: You will learn to form small words using letters and sounds. Try reading and writing short words by combining letters.
takehome: Look for words in your storybooks 📖
Write simple words you see around you
Practice reading words aloud
Try forming new words with letters you know
Ask a sibling or parent to read simple words with you
exercises: Write 5 simple words in your notebook ✏️
Draw pictures for 3 words (cat, dog, sun) 🖍️
Read 5 words aloud to a family member

title: Basic Sentences
content: You will learn to put words together to make short sentences. Practice saying and writing simple sentences about yourself and things around you.
examples: The cat is on the mat 🐱
takehome: Write 3 sentences about your family 👨‍👩‍👧
Read your sentences aloud every day
Try making sentences about your toys 🧸
Draw pictures for each sentence
Ask a friend or sibling to make a sentence with you
exercises: Write 5 sentences about your day ✏️
Underline the nouns in your sentences
Circle the verbs in your sentences

title: Reading Short Stories
content: Practice reading simple storybooks with pictures. Look at the pictures and read the sentences to understand the story.
examples: The cat sat on the mat 🐱
takehome: Read one short story each day 📖
Look at the pictures and try to tell the story
Try reading aloud to your family
Draw your favorite part of the story 🎨
Practice new words from the story
exercises: Read 3 short sentences from a book
Match sentences to pictures 🖼️
Draw a 3-picture story and write 1 sentence for each

title: Rhyming Words
content: You will learn words that sound alike. Rhyming helps you remember words and makes reading fun.
takehome: Find rhyming words in your books 📖
Try making 5 rhyming words with friends
Write rhyming words in your notebook ✏️
Say rhyming words aloud
Draw pictures for rhyming words
exercises: Write 3 sets of rhyming words
Match rhyming words from a list
Find a rhyming word for 'cat'

title: Nouns and Verbs
content: You will learn nouns (naming words) and verbs (action words). Nouns tell us what things are, verbs tell us what things do.
takehome: Look for nouns and verbs in your storybooks 📖
Write 5 nouns and 5 verbs in your notebook ✏️
Make 3 sentences using nouns and verbs
Draw pictures for each verb
Practice saying verbs aloud
exercises: Circle the nouns in a sentence
Underline the verbs in a sentence
Make 3 sentences using one noun and one verb each

title: Picture Reading
content: You will look at pictures and describe what you see. This helps you learn new words and improve speaking skills.
examples: A dog 🐕 → The dog is running
A girl 👧 → The girl is smiling
A tree 🌳 → The tree is tall
takehome: Look at pictures in books and describe them 📖
Draw a picture and write 1 sentence about it 🎨
Practice speaking about the picture to a friend
Try labeling objects in your room
Make a story using 3 pictures
exercises: Describe 3 pictures in your notebook
Draw a picture and write 2 sentences
Match sentences to pictures

title: Opposites
content: You will learn words that mean opposite things. Knowing opposites makes reading and speaking more fun.
takehome: Look for opposites in your storybooks 📖
Write 5 pairs of opposites ✏️
Act out opposites with friends or siblings 🤹
Draw opposite pictures
Say opposites aloud every day
exercises: Match opposites from a list
Write the opposite of 5 words
Circle opposites in sentences

title: Listening Skills
content: You will practice listening carefully to instructions and short stories. Listening helps you understand and follow directions.
takehome: Listen to a short story every day 📖
Repeat what you hear aloud
Ask a family member to give you instructions
Practice listening games with friends
Draw a picture of a story you listened to 🎨
exercises: Follow 3 simple instructions
Draw what you heard in a short story
Listen and write 3 key words from a story

title: Simple Dictation
content: You will practice writing simple words or short sentences that someone reads aloud. Dictation improves your spelling and handwriting.
takehome: Ask someone to read 5 words for you to write ✏️
Write 3 short sentences daily
Check your spelling and correct mistakes
Practice writing neatly
Read your dictation sentences aloud
exercises: Write 5 words read aloud
Write 3 sentences read aloud
Correct spelling mistakes in your notebook
